pullRequest.body:
This PR creates the type `CstarMatrix m n A` as a copy of `Matrix m n A` meant for the case where `A` is a C‚ãÜ-algebra. Most notably, we show that square matrices with entries in a C‚ãÜ-algebra form a C‚ãÜ-algebra.

- [x] depends on: #15244 
- [x] depends on: #15274 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Current commit [5df922fda1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/5df922fda11703d035ff63ef79548133e1f11ee3)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15244~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15274~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Sorry I let this sit.

I have lots of simplifications here.

One big issue: I'm not sure that we can use an `abbrev`. See my comment on the proof of `antilipschitzWith_toMatrixAux`.
Sorry I let this sit.
Note that this was needed for several lemmas. I also added several shortcut instances in the `WithCStarModule` material to deal with instance synthesis problems.

For consistency for the reader, we should probably just use `C‚ãÜ·µê·µí·µà (n ‚Üí A)` everywhere (although it would be nice to get VSCode input for `C‚ãÜ·µê·µí·µà`), which is available with `open scoped WithCStarModule`
Yeah, I'll do a search-and-replace. This issue is that these superscripts are really annoying to type.

I think this shouldn't really be necessary since `CStarMatrix` is an `abbrev`. Am I wrong for some reason?

That being said, it might make sense to have a `CStarMatrix.of`, implemented as `Matrix.of`, just to avoid needing type ascriptions or other elaboration hints when using `Matrix.of`.

I hate `change`. The problem here was the missing `@[simps! apply symm_apply]` on `WithCStarModule.equivL` (note: there's not defeq abuse with that `simps!` because it stops at `WithCStarModule.equiv`).
```suggestion
  map_smul' c M := by ext; simp [Matrix.mulVec, Finset.smul_sum, smul_mul_assoc, Matrix.dotProduct]
```
Do we really want `A` explicit here?
I guess not.
ditto
At least these two lemmas should move above `toCLMNonUnitalAlgHom`, otherwise it looks like we're just missing `simps`. Also, I think `toCLM_apply` should be `@[simp]`

The new proof of `map_zero'` works if you move `toCLM_apply` up and mark it `@[simp]`.
```suggestion
@[simps apply]
def toCLMNonUnitalAlgHom : CStarMatrix n n A ‚Üí‚Çô‚Çê[‚ÑÇ] (n ‚ÜíC‚ãÜ A) ‚ÜíL[‚ÑÇ] (n ‚ÜíC‚ãÜ A) :=
  { toCLM (n := n) (m := n) A with
    toFun := toCLM A
    map_zero' := by ext1; simp
    map_mul' := by intros; ext; simp [toCLM] }
```

Note that `WithCStarModule.equiv` is not protected (unlike in Lean 3, where it would need to be in order not to conflict with what is now `Equiv`), so opening the namespace can help.

Also, this should be `@[simp high]` to override `toCLM_apply`, and we can simplify the proof.
```suggestion
open WithCStarModule

@[simp high]
lemma toCLM_apply_single [DecidableEq n] {M : CStarMatrix m n A} {j : n} (a : A) :
    (toCLM A M) (equiv _ |>.symm <| Pi.single j a)
      = (equiv _).symm (fun i => M i j * a) := by
  simp [toCLM]
```

```suggestion
    (toCLM A M) (equiv _ |>.symm <| Pi.single j a) i = M i j * a := by
  simp
```

```suggestion
    star a * M i j * b
      = ‚ü™equiv _ |>.symm (Pi.single i a), toCLM A M (equiv _ |>.symm <| Pi.single j b)‚ü´_A := by
  simp [mul_assoc]
```

Might as well just get injectivity and then use the API
```suggestion
lemma toCLM_injective [DecidableEq n] : Function.Injective (toCLM A (m := m) (n := n)) := by
  rw [injective_iff_map_eq_zero]
  intro M h 
  ext i j
  rw [Matrix.zero_apply, ‚Üê norm_eq_zero, ‚Üê sq_eq_zero_iff, sq, ‚Üê CStarRing.norm_self_mul_star,
    ‚Üê toCLM_apply_single_apply]
  simp [h]
```

```suggestion
  simpa using toCLM_inner_right_eq_left (M := M·¥¥) (v := v) (w := w)
```

This lemma is missing, which avoids the `change`. Also, Lean infers that `MulActionWithZero` instance without issue, it's just that it's having trouble inferring it when the argument `toCLM A M` of `norm_smul` is left implicit. I'm not sure why.
```suggestion
lemma norm_def {M : CStarMatrix m n A} : ‚ÄñM‚Äñ = ‚ÄñtoCLM A M‚Äñ := rfl

lemma normedSpaceCore [DecidableEq n]: NormedSpace.Core ‚ÑÇ (CStarMatrix m n A) where
  norm_nonneg M := (toCLM A M).opNorm_nonneg
  norm_smul c M := by rw [norm_def, norm_def, map_smul, norm_smul _ (toCLM A M)]
  norm_triangle M‚ÇÅ M‚ÇÇ := by simpa [‚Üê map_add] using norm_add_le (toCLM A M‚ÇÅ) (toCLM A M‚ÇÇ)
  norm_eq_zero_iff := by
    simpa only [norm_def, norm_eq_zero, ‚Üê injective_iff_map_eq_zero'] using toCLM_injective 
```

Somehow you made this much harder on yourself than necessary, but I didn't try to figure out exactly why.
```suggestion
  suffices ‚ÄñM i j‚Äñ * ‚ÄñM i j‚Äñ ‚â§ ‚ÄñM‚Äñ * ‚ÄñM i j‚Äñ by
    obtain (h | h) := (norm_nonneg (M i j)).eq_or_lt
    ¬∑ simp [‚Üê h, norm_def]
    ¬∑ exact le_of_mul_le_mul_right this h
  rw [‚Üê CStarRing.norm_self_mul_star, ‚Üê toCLM_apply_single_apply]
  apply norm_apply_le_norm _ _ |>.trans
  apply (toCLM A M).le_opNorm _ |>.trans
  simp [norm_def]
```

It's easier to just square it. (Although given that I've done this argument twice now, `‚Äñ¬∑‚Äñ ‚â§ 0` one, I really dislike that we don't have a lemma `x = 0 ‚à® 0 < ‚Äñx‚Äñ` for `NormedAddCommGroup`.)
```suggestion
  refine (toCLM A M).opNorm_le_bound (by simp) fun v ‚Ü¶ ?_
  obtain (h‚ÇÄ | h‚ÇÄ) := (norm_nonneg (toCLM A M v)).eq_or_lt
  ¬∑ rw [‚Üê h‚ÇÄ]
    positivity
  ¬∑ refine le_of_mul_le_mul_right ?_ h‚ÇÄ
    simpa [‚Üê sq, norm_sq_eq] using h ..
```
So what lemma did you think was missing?

This one: `lemma x = 0 ‚à® 0 < ‚Äñx‚Äñ` for `NormedAddCommGroup`.

I want to be able to write `rfl` in the first argument of `obtain`. I know it's minor, but I've definitely run into this before, and this time it clicked because I did it twice back-to-back.
I just added this lemma.

```suggestion
  rw [one_mul, ‚Üê NNReal.coe_le_coe, coe_nnnorm, coe_nnnorm, Matrix.norm_le_iff (norm_nonneg _)]
  exact fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ CStarMatrix.norm_entry_le_norm
```

This needs the following, or else the proof breaks, see for yourself.
```lean
attribute [-instance] CStarMatrix.instNorm -- to avoid Lean seeing this instance on `Matrix m n A`?
```
This actually seems like a big problem. Lean sees the `CStarMatrix` norm on `Matrix` because it's an `abbrev`, even when the bit in question is `toMatrixAux A`, which is declared to have type `Matrix m n A`.

It's possible that this won't come up enough in our own work to matter, and probably in other places in the library Lean would have no business inferring `CStarMatrix` in place of `Matrix`, *but* I could imagine people would be pretty upset if they were using their `Matric n n ‚ÑÇ` and all of a sudden our `CStarMatrix` norm came waltzing in.

It's possible we can't use `abbrev`. What do you think?

```suggestion
open CStarMatrix WithCStarModule in
private lemma antilipschitzWith_toMatrixAux :
    AntilipschitzWith (Fintype.card m * Fintype.card n)
      (toMatrixAux : CStarMatrixAux m n A ‚Üí Matrix m n A) := by
  refine AddMonoidHomClass.antilipschitz_of_bound _ fun M => ?_
  calc
    ‚ÄñM‚Äñ ‚â§ ‚àë i, ‚àë j, ‚ÄñM i j‚Äñ := by
      rw [norm_def]
      refine (toCLM A M).opNorm_le_bound (by positivity) fun v => ?_
      simp only [toCLM_apply_eq_sum, equiv_symm_pi_apply, Finset.sum_mul]
      apply pi_norm_le_sum_norm _ |>.trans
      gcongr with i _
      apply norm_sum_le _ _ |>.trans
      gcongr with j _
      apply norm_mul_le _ _ |>.trans
      gcongr
      exact norm_apply_le_norm v j
    _ ‚â§ ‚àë _ : m, ‚àë _ : n, ‚ÄñtoMatrixAux M‚Äñ := by
      gcongr with i _ j _
      exact toMatrixAux M |>.norm_entry_le_entrywise_sup_norm
    _ = _ := by simp [mul_assoc]
```

I agree this is horrible. I didn't think Lean would try to go "backwards" like this to find an instance (meaning going to `CStarMatrix` to find something about `Matrix`). I'll switch the whole thing from `abbrev` to `def` when I get a bit of time.
I didn't think it would do that either. This sucks. ‚òπÔ∏è

```suggestion

lemma norm_def {M : CStarMatrix m n A} : ‚ÄñM‚Äñ = ‚ÄñtoCLM A M‚Äñ := rfl

lemma norm_def' {M : CStarMatrix n n A} : ‚ÄñM‚Äñ = ‚ÄñtoCLMNonUnitalAlgHom A M‚Äñ := rfl

lemma normedSpaceCore [DecidableEq n]: NormedSpace.Core ‚ÑÇ (CStarMatrix m n A) where
```

See below
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  norm_mul _ _ := by simpa only [norm_def', map_mul] using norm_mul_le _ _
```

```suggestion
  norm_mul := norm_mul_le
```

```suggestion
  norm_smul_le r M := by simpa only [norm_def, map_smul] using (toCLM A M).opNorm_smul_le r 
```
Oof, yeah, that's going to be annoying, but sure, I should do that soon.
Does `inferInstanceAs` not work?

```suggestion
a C‚ãÜ-algebra when `m = n`. -/
```
Not `@[simp]`?
`inferInstanceAs` doesn't work?
I don't think we should use the local notation in docstrings.

```suggestion
/-- `ofMatrix` bundled as a continuous linear equivalence. -/
```
Where exactly is this needed? Can you just activate it locally (even in the proof) so we can see exactly where the problems occur?

pullRequest.title: feat(CStarAlgebra): matrices with entries in a C‚ãÜ-algebra

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
